column1: The side your blocked carotid artery is on faces up.
- The surgeon makes a cut (incision) on your neck over your carotid artery.
- Medicine and diet to lower your cholesterol.
Some of these medicines are aspirin, clopidogrel (Plavix), and warfarin (Coumadin).

Risks of anesthesia are: - Allergic reactions to medicines - Breathing problems Risks of carotid surgery are: - Blood clots or bleeding in the brain - Brain damage - Heart attack - More blockage of the carotid artery over time - Seizures - Stroke - Swelling near your airway (the tube you breathe through) - Infection
These include aspirin, ibuprofen (Advil, Motrin), clopidogrel (Plavix), naprosyn (Aleve, Naproxen), and other drugs like these.
Follow instructions on when to arrive at the hospital.
After surgery, your doctor may want you to stay in the hospital overnight so that nurses can watch you for any signs of bleeding, stroke, or poor blood flow to your brain.
